archimate:DataObject.name: MetricDimension
archimate:DataObject.documentation: A metric dimension designates a method of organizing individual metrics into common sets; related by the value of the named dimension. An example would be a metric for revenue--individual instance values of revenue could be organized in the dimension of geography (Region 1 Revenues; Region 2 Revenues; etc.); or by Product (Wireless Revenue; Wire-line Revenue; Broadband Revenue; Advertising Revenue; etc.). The characteristic term when discussing Dimension is by; as in Revenue; by Product or Revenue; by Region.
